title: Sample proportion and sample size I

content.question:
A one-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math>-test for a population proportion was conducted to test <math alttext="H sub 0, colon, p equals 0.35" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.35</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, p is not equal to 0.35" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>a</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>â‰ </mo><mn>0.35</mn></math>.
Assuming the conditions for inference were met, which combination of sample proportion and sample size would result in the smallest <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value of the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="p hat equals 0.35" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.35</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 200" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn></math>

<math alttext="p hat equals 0.40" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 100" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></math>

<math alttext="p hat equals 0.40" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 60" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>

<math alttext="p hat equals 0.25" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.25</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 100" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></math>

<math alttext="p hat equals 0.25" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.25</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 60" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p hat equals 0.25" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.25</mn></math> and <math alttext="n equals 100" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></math>

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
